event.title: was named Puerto Cordova by Spanish explorer Salvador Fidalgo in 1790

data.event: Cordova was named Puerto Cordova by Spanish explorer Salvador Fidalgo in 1790.
In the Exxon Valdez oil spill of March 1989, an oil tanker ran aground northwest of Cordova, heavily damaging ecology and fishing.

event.title: 1790 the inlet in front of the current Cordova townsite was named

data.event: In 1790 the inlet in front of the current Cordova townsite was named Puerto Cordova by Spanish explorer Salvador Fidalgo, after Spanish admiral Luis de Córdova y Córdova.
A week later crews arrived to begin work on the railroad.
The first lots in the new town site, which make up the heart of present-day Cordova, were sold at auction in May 1908.
